thread.title: Irish dancing breaks out on Aer Lingus flight after band start playing traditional music
thread.title_full: Irish dancing breaks out on Aer Lingus flight after band start playing traditional music | Daily Mail Online

author: Jake Polden For Mailonline
title: Irish dancing breaks out on Aer Lingus flight after band start playing traditional music
text:
View
comments
This is the hilarious moment Irish dancing broke out on an Aer Lingus flight after a member of the cabin crew decided to put on an impromptu show.
Prior to the in-flight performance a band had started playing traditional Irish music to the delight of the people on board the aircraft.
Going the extra mile, Orla O'Brien, who later posted a video of the moment she started dancing to Facebook, got to her feet to perform a little jig.
Going the extra mile, Orla O'Brien got to her feet to perform a little jig with one of the passengers on the flight
In the video Orla can be seen laughing while jumping about inside the cabin alongside a male passenger on board the flight.
The pair dance with each other for the duration of the clip as people circle around them and attempt to film the performance on their camera phones.
 Next Through the eyes of a sea lion! GoPro captures mesmerising... Cheeky feline opens door like a human... only to then look... Heart-stopping moment hot air balloon comes within inches of... Is this the world's angriest cyclist? Man abuses fellow... Meanwhile the band play traditional Irish music in the background to compliment the dancing perfectly.
The video concludes with the musicians bringing their performance to an end and the dancers pulling each other in for a hug.
Spectators can be heard applauding the efforts of both the band and the talented air stewardess.
While the duo danced a band played traditional Irish music in the background to compliment their moves
Since being posted to Facebook, alongside the caption 'In-flight entertainment at its best,' the video has been viewed more than 21,000 times.
Commenting on the clip, one Quote: : 'You're some character Orla O' Brien,' while another added: 'So that's what you get up to up in the clouds. Brilliant Orla.'
A third person said: 'Is there a new section in the Aer Lingus website that you can request a trad session on your flight?'
